Both caffeine and heavy meals can disrupt your sleep. Try to limit caffeine intake in the afternoon and evening and avoid eating large meals close to bedtime.

Ensure your bedroom is conducive to sleep: cool, dark, and quiet. Consider using blackout curtains, eye masks, earplugs, or white noise machines if necessary.
